3.60 
Conditions for the dissolution of the marriage 
1. A spouse may request the dissolution of the marriage on the grounds set out in this Section if the marriage is in fact dissolved through the fault of the other spouse. 
2. A spouse shall be guilty of the dissolution of the marriage if he or she has substantially breached his or her obligations as a spouse under this Book, with the result that cohabitation between the spouses has become impossible. 
3. The other spouse shall be presumed to be at fault for the dissolution of the marriage if he or she is convicted of a deliberate crime or is unfaithful or cruel to the other spouse or to members of the family, or if he or she has abandoned his or her family and has failed to provide for it for more than one year.
